desc: The Neapolitan pizza is a classic Italian pizza originating from Naples. It is known for its simplicity, with a thin crust, San Marzano tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, and olive oil. This style of pizza has a long history, with the Margherita pizza, named after Queen Margherita, being one of its most famous variations.
name: Neapolitan

desc: The Spanish pizza is a variation of pizza that includes traditional Spanish ingredients such as Serrano ham, olives, and peppers. Its history is connected to the global popularity of Spanish cuisine.
name: Spanish

desc: Salami pizza is an American creation that combines cheese, tomato sauce, and slices of salami. It has become a favorite choice in many U.S. pizzerias.
name: Salami

desc: The Four Seasons pizza is an Italian pizza divided into four sections, each with different ingredients to represent the seasons: spring, summer, autumn, and winter. For example, the spring section might include artichokes and ham, while the summer section could have mushrooms and black olives.
name: Four Seasons

desc: Bacon pizza is a variant that includes crispy bacon strips as one of the main ingredients. Bacon adds a smoky and salty flavor that complements the cheese and tomato sauce.
name: Bacon

name: Spicy Chicken
